page.title: 16CABOURNE HIGH,NEW CLOSE WOOD
page.content: New trees are planted all the time to replace older trees. 30,000 new trees are planted every year in Brocklesby estate. The wood is taken to local sawmills mainly in the areas of Grimsby, Horncastle, Lincoln and Scunthorpe. Eighteen people work in the woodlands,which consists of a Head Forester, a production foreman who is in charge of a gang of five timber fellers and one lorry driver. The maintenance foreman is responsible for fencing, planting, weeding and early plantation thinnings. There is also a sawmill foreman and three sawmill workers.Chainsaws are used to fell the trees. Workers in the forest start at 8am and finish at 4.30pm. Our block has fifteen percent forest cover.
